DOC.HEAD: State Department: U.S. Supports New Romanian Government
DOC.TEXT: The United States is seeking ways to supply further emergency medical assistance to the new, pro-democracy government in Romania, the State Department said Saturday. ``The United States supports the newly constituted Romanian government and its commitment to democratic reforms,'' a statement issued by the department said. In Bucharest on Saturday, provisional government leaders said they captured deposed President Nicolae Ceausescu and they pledged to put Eastern Europe's last Stalinist dictator on trial for persecuting the nation. The National Salvation Committee, the name of Romania's provisional revolutionary governing coalition, has announced a program of democratic reform. The State Department said the United States views the provisional government as ``the manifestation of the democratic will of the Romanian people.'' It called on remaining Ceausescu supporters, including members of the secret police, to ``lay down their arms and put an end to the tragic bloodshed in Romania.'' Humanitarian aid already has been offered by the United States and efforts are being made to supply further medical assistance, the State Department said. U.S. officials are consulting with allies and others, including the Soviet Union, on the evolving situation, the statement said. ``The United States calls on the international community to offer its moral and political support to the cause of democracy in Romania,'' the State Department said.
